metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6789 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the base64d function in the SMTP listener in Exim before 4.90.1. By sending a handcrafted message, a buffer overflow may happen. This can be used to execute code remotely.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.4').
